intro: Eurybia microphylla, commonly known as the dwarf sunflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces daisy-like yellow flowers with white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, making it a low-growing member of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows and marshy areas. Eurybia microphylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
